news.title: Does vitamin D deficiency increase COVID-19 risk?
news.summary: A new paper published on the preprint server medRxiv * in May 2020 reports the first evidence that vitamin D deficiency and inadequate treatment could increase the chances of testing positive for COVID-19.

news.title: Does Vitamin D Protect Against COVID-19?
news.summary: Q: Does vitamin D help protect against COVID-19? A: Some scientists have hypothesized vitamin D might be helpful, but there is no direct evidence that vitamin D can prevent COVID-19 or lessen disease severity.

news.title: Shedding Sunlight on the Coronavirus Epidemic

news.title: Exploring the Links Between Coronavirus and Vitamin D
news.summary: In the past decade, studies have found that taking vitamin D can lower the odds of developing respiratory infections like the cold and the flu, especially among people who have documented deficiencies.

news.title: Researchers investigating possible link between vitamin D deficiency and COVID-19

news.title: Vitamin D and COVID-19: Experts say any possible link is ‘premature’
news.summary: Aside from a potential vaccine, there’s no surefire answer to COVID-19. Scientists agree on the basic hygiene principles to avoid infection as well as on the primary way the virus is transmitted.

facebook.title: Association of Vitamin D Deficiency and Treatment with COVID-19 Incidence

blogs.title: Exploring the Links Between Coronavirus and Vitamin D
